post.description:
This operation allows you to setup your customer (individual) via our API.

The endpoint requires you to provide some of the details from your onboarding process 
for us to be able to setup an account and process payment on behalf of your customer.

The endpoint's response includes an `id`, which is future reference for created customer.


### Example request:

```JSON
{
  "namePrefix": "Mr.",
  "firstName": "john",
  "lastName": "smith",
  "nationality": "GB",
  "dateOfBirth": "1980-01-01",
  "placeOfBirth": "United Kingdom",
  "identification": {
    "type": "NATIONAL_ID",
    "number": "123456789"
  },
  "address": {
    "country": "GB",
    "postalCode": "SW1A 2AA",
    "city": "London",
    "street": "High Street",
    "buildingNumber": "46"
  },
  "phoneNumber": "+447895222333",
  "email": "john.smith@thebankoflondon.com",
  "organisationId": "u5vab5K9RZFTTzNJNAs3H"
}
```

### Example response:

```JSON
{
  "id": "KNm9u_s8r02SVOf4xVtIQ",
  "namePrefix": "Mr.",
  "firstName": "john",
  "lastName": "smith",
  "nationality": "GB", 
  "dateOfBirth": "1980-01-01",
  "placeOfBirth": "United Kingdom",
  "identification": {
    "type": "NATIONAL_ID",
    "number": "123456789"

}
```

get.description:
This operation allows to retrieve a list of transactions for a virtual account along with the transaction ID
(`id`) to be able to retrieve a specific transaction later via `GET
/transactions/{transactionId}`.

It must be filtered by either The Bank of London virtual account ID (`accountId`) to
retrieve only payments for a specific virtual account or by the `headerAccountId` to 
retrieve all transactions for all virtual accounts under the header account.

It can also be filtered by the `fromDate`, `toDate` and `transactionType` fields to narrow down the result set.

### Example request:
```
GET /virtual/transactions?accountId=GB-040075-12345678&fromDate=2020-10-10&toDate=2020-10-12
```
### Example for filtering by type:
```
GET /virtual/transactions?accountId=GB-040075-12345678&fromDate=2020-10-10&toDate=2020-10-12&transactionType=INTERNAL_DEBIT_THIRD_PARTY
```
The API will respond with an array of objects that contain all the details of the resulting transactions.
### Example response:
```JSON
{
  "transactions": [
    {
      "id": "0022484107DB1EED9D85FA3B8119427D001",
      "type": "INTERNAL_DEBIT_THIRD_PARTY",
      "typeDescription": "Outbound internal transfer (third party)",
      "sender": {
        "type": "TBOL",
        "accountId": "GB-040075-12345678",
        "accountNumber": "12345678",
        "sortCode": "040075"
      },
      "recipient": {
        "type": "TBOL",
        "accountId": "GB-040075-12345678",
        "accountNumber": "12345678",
        "sortCode": "040075"
      },
      "isCredit": "false",
      "reference": "Invoice 12345",
      "notes": "My first transaction",
      "amount": {
        "currency": "GBP",
        "value": 4320.5
      },
      "postingDate": "2022-10-07",
      "releaseDateTime": "2022-10-07T08:55:33.213Z",
      "valueDate": "2022-10-07",
      "createdDateTime": "2022-10-07T08:55:33.213Z",
      "account": {
        "currency": "GBP",
        "balance": 5000
      },
      "status": {
        "identifier": "SUCCESSFUL"
      }
    },
    {...}
  ],
  "metadata": {
    "totalRecords": 2,
    "pageSize": 20,
    "page": 1
  },
}
```

parameters.name: headerAccountId
parameters.description: If specified, the response will return the transactions of all virtual accounts which have headerAccountId set to the provided value.

post.description:
This operation initiates a payment in the context of
an application registered with The Bank of London Developer Studio. It takes a request body
that contains all the necessary information required to issue a single internal payment.

All payments must originate from a Bank of London account (`sender` field). 
The `recipient` field  must be a Bank of London account ID that is owned by the requesting account holder, otherwise the request will be rejected.
A customer can only transfer between two of their own accounts eg. Operating Account  Client Collateral Account.

## Single Internal Debit Payment

### Example request body:
```JSON
{
  "type": "INTERNAL_DEBIT",
  "sender": {
    "type": "TBOL",
    "accountId": "GB-040075-12345678"
  },
  "recipient": {
    "type": "TBOL",
    "accountId": "GB-040075-87654321"
  },
  "amount": {
    "currency": "GBP",
    "value": 4320.5
  },
  "reference": "INV-12345",
  "notes": "my custom note",
  "idempotencyId": "32ed5f75-638e-454c-a91b-ec16dc8f6e84"
}
```

The API will return the ID of the created payment along with its
status after initiation. The ID can be used to retrieve the payment
details (`GET /payments/{paymentId}`) including its current status in the
future.

### Example response:
```JSON
{
  "id": "FItJ8s2G-aOUfXUFqzRXE",
  "type": "INTERNAL_DEBIT",
  "scheme": "INTERNAL",
  "sender": {
    "type": "TBOL",
    "accountId": "GB-040075-12345678"
    "sortCode": "040075",
    "accountNumber": "12345678"
  },
  "recipient": {
    "type": "TBOL",
    "accountId": "GB-040075-87654321"
    "accountHolderName": "John Smith",
    "sortCode": "040075",
    "accountNumber": "87654321"
  },
  "amount": {
    "currency": "GBP",
    "value": 4320.5
  },
  "reference": "INV-12345",
  "notes": "my custom note",
  "plannedExecutionDateTime": "2022-10-05T00:00:00.000Z",
  "status": {
    "identifier":"PENDING",
    "detailedStatusIdentifier":"RECEIVED",
    "history": [
      {
        "identifier":"PENDING",
        "detailedStatusIdentifier":"RECEIVED",
        "dateTime":"2024-05-02T15:51:15.792Z"
      },
      {
        "identifier":"PENDING",
        "detailedStatusIdentifier":"PENDING",
        "dateTime":"2024-05-02T15:51:14.939Z"
      }
    ]
  },
  "createdDateTime": "2023-10-05T12:55:54.946Z",
  "createdBy": "64e739504746e6fe27ed53b5",
  "paymentOrderId": "S4B1  20240510000000065638",
  "idempotencyId": "32ed5f75-638e-454c-a91b-ec16dc8f6e84",
  "creator": {
    "type": "API",
    "key": "03967d18-5152-4f5a-9276-7f96c96f05ba"
  }
}
```

## Immediate and Future Payments

Providing `plannedExecutionDateTime` for `INTERNAL_DEBIT` payment will schedule a future payment whereas omitting the
`plannedExecutionDateTime` will result in an immediate payment.


The consumer application (identified by the API key) must always have
the permission to execute payments from the sender's account.

post.description:
This operation initiates a payment in the context of
an application registered with The Bank of London Developer Studio. It takes a request body
that contains all the necessary information required to issue a single payment.

All payments must originate from a Bank of London account (`sender` field)
and can be transferred to either a Bank of London account or any UK domestic
account of another bank.

## Single FPS Debit Payment

### Example request body:
```JSON
{
  "type": "FPS_DEBIT",
  "sender": {
    "type": "TBOL",
    "accountId": "GB-040075-12345678"
  },
  "recipient": {
    "type": "UK",
    "accountHolderName": "John Smith",
    "sortCode": "123456",
    "accountNumber": "12345678"
  },
  "amount": {
    "currency": "GBP",
    "value": 4320.5
  },

  "idempotencyId": "32ed5f75-638e-454c-a91b-ec16dc8f6e84"
}
```

The API will return the ID of the created payment along with its
status after initiation. The ID can be used to retrieve the payment
details (`GET /payments/{paymentId}`) including its current status in the
future.

### Example response:
```JSON

  "id": "FItJ8s2G-aOUfXUFqzRXE",

    "identifier":"PENDING",
    "detailedStatusIdentifier":"RECEIVED",
    "history": [
      {
        "identifier":"PENDING",

  }
}
```

## Immediate and Future Payments

Providing `plannedExecutionDateTime` for `FPS_DEBIT` payment will schedule a future payment whereas omitting the
`plannedExecutionDateTime` will result in an immediate payment.


The consumer application (identified by the API key) must always have
the permission to execute payments from the sender's account.

post.description:
This operation initiates a CHAPS payment in the context of
an application registered with The Bank of London Developer Studio. It takes a request body
that contains all the necessary information required to issue a
single CHAPS payment.

CHAPS operates same day processing between Monday to Friday; our current cut off for same day payment is 1.00PM,
and payments submitted after this cut-off time will be processed the next working day. The scheme does not 
operate on weekends and bank holidays (England & Wales).

Please ensure that any CHAPS payments are only made on your behalf and not on behalf of your clients 
(if applicable).

Virtual accounts cannot be used for CHAPS payments.

TBOL uses an agency bank to process CHAPS payments on its behalf; CHAPS payments cannot be reversed. If you need
any assistance, please contact us as soon as possible at uksupport@thebankoflondon.com or call us on 
+443301 659 131

## Single CHAPS Payment

### Example request body:
```JSON
{
  "type": "CHAPS_DEBIT",
  "sender": {
    "type": "TBOL",
    "accountId": "GB-040075-12345678"

    "type": "UK",

get.description:
This operation allows to retrieve a list of transactions along with the transaction ID
(`id`) to be able to retrieve a specific transaction later via `GET
/transactions/{transactionId}`.

It must be filtered by The Bank of London account ID (`accountId`) to
retrieve only payments for a specific account. 

It can also be filtered by the `fromDate`, `toDate` and `transactionType` fields to narrow down the result
set.

### Example request:

```
GET /transactions?accountId=GB-040075-12345678&fromDate=2020-10-10&toDate=2020-10-12
```

### Example for filtering by type:
```
GET /transactions?accountId=GB-040075-12345678&fromDate=2020-10-10&toDate=2020-10-12&transactionType=INTERNAL_DEBIT_THIRD_PARTY
```

The API will respond with an array of objects that contain all the details of the resulting transactions.

post.description:
This operation allows you to configure Webhooks, enabling you to receive notifications about various events related to your payments or transactions.

The response includes the public key of the webhook. The public key is used to verify the signature of the webhook events.

For more details on our webhook solution, please read [our webhooks guide](https://developer.thebankoflondon.com/docs/guides/manage-webhooks-guide).

### Example request:

```JSON
{
  "name": "My Webhook",
  "url": "https://www.your-webhook-handling-url.com/api/payment-event-callback",
  "events": [
    "TRANSACTION_SUCCESSFUL"
  ],
  "version": 2
}
```

### Example response:

```json
{
  "id": "QF6T5cuAyRE3BnHFHWD0z",
  "name": "My Webhook",
  "url": "https://www.your-webhook-handling-url.com/api/payment-event-callback",
  "events": [
    "TRANSACTION_SUCCESSFUL"
  ],
  "version": 2,
  "enabled": true,
  "publicKey": "-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----\nMvQI...SjAgEA-----END PUBLIC KEY-----",
  "createdDate": "2020-01-01T00:00:00.000Z"
}
```

requestBody.description: The object containing data about the Webhook.

events.description: **Attention** \ Please note that the allowed values for the **events** are extensible and new values can be added in the future without a major version change. Please ensure this is factored into your application code. The type of event. \ `PAYMENT_PENDING` - payment has been created and is `PENDING` or `SCHEDULED`. \ `PAYMENT_SUCCESSFUL` - payment has become `SUCCESSFUL`. \ `PAYMENT_FAILED` - payment has been updated with a status of `REJECTED` or `FAILED`. \ `TRANSACTION_SUCCESSFUL` - transaction has been created and successfully settled. \ `TRANSACTION_EXPORT_SUCCESSFUL` - transaction export has completed successfully. \ `TRANSACTION_EXPORT_FAILED` - transaction export has failed.

post.description:
This operation allows you to create a test event for a webhook.

Returns an empty response if the provided `id` is valid. Otherwise, a response with a 404 status code is returned.

If the webhook is not enabled, a response with a 400 status code is returned.

If the request to the webhook fails, an email will be sent to all users of the consumer application with the Webhook Degradation contact preference enabled.

For more details on our webhook solution, please read [our webhooks guide](https://developer.thebankoflondon.com/docs/guides/manage-webhooks-guide).

### Example request:

```
POST /webhooks/RBf1q02PaupHGtVFcLm_S/create-test-event
```

POST /webhooks/RBf1q02PaupHGtVFcLm_S/regenerate-key

Please ensure this is factored into your application code. **Default allowed clients types are:** \ `GOVERNMENT_OR_NOT_FOR_PROFIT` - A government/public body, or a not-for-profit firm (e.g. charities) that is not regulated by a financial services regulator. \ `PROFESSIONAL_PRACTICE` - A professional practice such as a law firm or accountancy practice that is not regulated by a financial services regulator. \ `CORPORATE_BUSINESS_LARGE` - Any other type of firm, with a turnover of greater than 10M or greater than 10 employees that is not regulated by a financial services regulator. \ `CORPORATE_BUSINESS_SMALL` - Any other type of firm, with a turnover of less than 10M and less than 10 employees that is not regulated by a financial services regulator. \ `OTHER_NON_REGULATED` - Any other type of business that does not fit into any other client type and is not regulated by a financial services regulator. **If you require any of the following client types, please contact us.** \ `BANK` - A bank that is regulated by a recognised regulator. \ `BUILDING_SOCIETY_OR_CREDIT_UNION` - A building society or credit union that's regulated by a recognised regulator. \ `PAYMENT_INSTITUTION` - A payments business that is regulated by a recognised regulator. \ `MONEY_SERVICE_BUSINESS` - A money service business that is regulated by a recognised regulator. \ `ELECTRONIC_MONEY_INSTITUTION` - A electronic money business that is regulated by a recognised regulator. \ `DIGITAL_ASSETS_STABLE_COIN_ISSUER` - A digital assets firm that doesn't fit into the other digital assets client types, and is regulated by a recognised regulator. \ `FUNDS` - A funds investment business that is regulated by a recognised regulator. \ `OTHER_REGULATED` - A regulated firm that doesn't fit into the other regulated client types (e.g. an insurance broker), and is regulated by a recognised regulator. \ `DEPOSIT_AGGREGATOR` - A deposit aggregator that is regulated by a recognised regulator.

Supplying the `accountOwnership` will return virtual accounts for specific ownership. \
`ALL`: all virtual accounts directly and indirectly linked to the requestor \
`DIRECT`: virtual accounts directly linked to the requestor \
`INDIRECT`: virtual accounts for both individuals and organisations

AccountType1.description: **Attention** \ Please note that the allowed values for the **type** are extensible and new can be added in the future without a major version change. Please ensure this is factored into your application code. The type of account \ `VIRTUAL_ACCOUNT`: Virtual Deposit Account. Accounts can be internally or externally addressable, both forms support direct and indirect payments. \ `VIRTUAL_SUSPENSE`: Virtual Suspense Account. Manages the balancing of the virtual hierarchy in case of an unreconciled payment. \ `VIRTUAL_PANDL`: Virtual Profit & Loss Account. Allows profit to be taken from Virtual Account hierarchy by having different interest between real and virtual hierarchies.

The oldest posting date from which the transactions will be
provided.

TransactionType.description:
Type of the transaction. \
`BACS_DIRECT_CREDIT_INBOUND`: Inbound BACS Direct Credit Payment \
`BACS_DIRECT_CREDIT_OUTBOUND`: Outbound BACS Direct Credit Payment \
`BACS_DIRECT_DEBIT_COLL`: BACS Direct Debit Outbound Collection \
`BACS_DIRECT_DEBIT_FINALDDI`: BACS Direct Debit Outbound Final Payment per Direct Debit Instruction \
`BACS_DIRECT_DEBIT_FIRSTDDI`: BACS Direct Debit Outbound First Payment per Direct Debit Instruction \
`BACS_DIRECT_DEBIT_REGULARDDI`: BACS Direct Debit Outbound Regular Payment per Direct Debit Instruction \
`BACS_DIRECT_DEBIT_REPRES`: BACS Direct Debit Unable to Apply First Time \
`BACS_DIRECT_DEBIT_RETURN`: Returned Bacs Direct Debit \
`BACS_RECALL`: Recall of BACS outbound direct credit \
`BACS_REFUND`: Refund of BACS outbound direct credit \
`BACS_REVERSAL_DIRECTCREDIT`: Reversal of BACS outbound direct credit \
`BACS_REVERSAL_DIRECTDEBIT`: Reversal of BACS outbound direct debit \
`CHAPS_CREDIT`: Inbound CHAPS payment \
`CHAPS_DEBIT_OUTBND`: Outbound CHAPS payment \
`CHAPS_DEBIT_OUTBNDSOP`: Outbound CHAPS payment \
`CHAPS_RETURNED_CREDIT`: Returned CHAPS credit \
`CHAPS_RETURNED_CREDIT_OUTBND`: Returned CHAPS credit for an Previous Outbound Transfer \
`FPS_CREDIT`: Inbound Faster Payment \
`FPS_INTL_CREDIT`: Inbound Faster Payment that originated overseas \
`FPS_DEBIT`: Outbound Faster Payment \
`FPS_RETURN_CREDIT`: Returned Faster Payments credit \
`FPS_RETURNED_CREDIT`: Returned outbound Faster Payment \
`FPS_SCHEDULED_DEBIT`: Outbound future dated payment Faster Payments \
`FPS_STANDING_ORDER_DEBIT`: Outbound standing order payments Faster Payments \
`ACCOUNT_CLOSURE_CREDIT`: Credit for account balance clear on closure of The Bank of London account. \
`ACCOUNT_CLOSURE_CREDIT_COLL`: Credit from collection authorization at closure of The Bank of London account \
`ACCOUNT_CLOSURE_DEBIT`: Debit for account balance clear on closure of The Bank of London account \
`ACCOUNT_CLOSURE_DEBIT_OUTBND`: Debit for account balance clear on closure of The Bank of London account, process an outbound payment to an external account \

TransactionIsCreditQueryParam.description: Returns the transactions that are credit (`isCredit=true`) or debit (`isCredit=false`). If not provided, both credit and debit transactions are returned.

TransactionSearch.description:
Enables transaction search by `sender.reference`, `recipient.reference`, `recipient.accountHolderName`, `typeDescription`, and `amount.value`. 

The search is case-insensitive and supports partial matches. The search query must be a maximum of 30 characters.

You can include multiple words in the search query, separated by spaces. When multiple words are provided, the search returns transactions containing all the words in the query.

If an amount is specified, the search returns both credit and debit transactions matching that amount.

Transactions are ordered by `createdDateTime` by default. You can change the order using the `orderBy` query parameter.

Please ensure this is factored into your application code. `PAYMENT`: movement of funds which results in debit or credit on a TBOL account, but the other side of the transaction is external to TBOL (the funds were received by TBOL from external sender, or left TBOL to external beneficiary) \ `DIRECT_DEBIT`: movement of funds which requires a mandate in order to be executed. Currently only applicable to Bacs. \ `TRANSFER`: movement of funds between accounts of the same customer within TBOL. \ `INTERNAL_TRANSFER`: movement of funds between TBOL accounts held by different customers. \ `FEE`: any type of fee deducted for periodic billing or other operational processes. \ `INTEREST`: any type of interest applied to TBOL account`

ParentAggregatorNodeIdRequest.description: This allows you to set where in the virtual hierarchy your virtual aggregator node will be positioned. PlannedPaymentExecutionDateTime.description: The date and time when the payment should be executed by The Bank of London. Any future date and time can be provided to schedule a future payment. The date time should be formatted to the UTC date format (ISO8601). The time element is considered within 1 minute intervals, and payment will be released as close to the specified instructed time as possible.  2024-11-01T12:15:00.000Z is a valid example. If no date time is provided, this will be defaulted to the current date time.

PaymentStatusQueryParam.description:
Payment statuses listed below can be used as query values. In order to query for \
multiple statuses, the query param can be repeated \
e.g ...?status=PENDING&status=SUCCESSFUL \
 \
`PENDING_APPROVAL`: Initial status of a payment that requires approval before processing. \
`PENDING`: Payment is currently being processed within The Bank of London system.  \
`APPROVED`: The payment has been approved by an authorised payment approver  \
`REJECTED`: The payment has been rejected by an authorised payment approver  \
`SUCCESSFUL`: Payment has been processed and passed all checks.  \
`FAILED`: One or more checks failed whilst processing the payment.

PaymentFrequency.description: Frequency of a standing order payment. The Bank of London will use this value to set the payment execution dates after the date of first execution (`startDateTime`). Together with the end date (`endDateTime`) or the number of payments (`numberOfPayments`) the payment schedule is determined.

StartDateTime.description: The date when the standing order payment should be executed by The Bank of London. Any weekday date can be provided to schedule a future payment with the exclusion of weekends and public holidays. The date time should be formatted to the UTC date format (ISO8601). The time element will be ignored on the date time. `2022-10-05T11:01:00.000Z` is a valid example. If no date time is provided, this will be defaulted to the current date time.

NumberOfPayments.description: The number of payments that should be made for a standing order.

EndDateTime.description: The date when the standing order payment should be executed by The Bank of London. Any future date can be provided to schedule a future payment. The date time should be formatted to the UTC date format (ISO8601). The time element will be ignored on the date time. `2022-10-05T13:01:00.000Z` is a valid example.

StandingOrderSchedule.description: Represents the details of the standing order schedule. `frequency` is required, then either `numberOfPayments` or `endDateTime` must be provided.

StandingOrderStatusQueryParam.description:
Standing order statuses listed below can be used as query values. In order to query for \
multiple statuses, the query param can be repeated \
e.g ...?status=PENDING&status=ACTIVE \
 \
`PENDING_APPROVAL`: Initial status of a standing order that requires approval before processing. \
`PENDING`: Standing order is currently being processed within The Bank of London system.  \
`APPROVED`: The standing order has been approved by an authorised payment approver  \
`REJECTED`: The standing order has been rejected by an authorised payment approver  \
`ACTIVE`: The standing order instruction is active and will make payments at the cadence defined by the schedule  \
`FAILED`: One or more checks failed whilst processing the standing order. \
`INACTIVE`: The instruction has reached end-of-life, it has either executed the number of payments configured or has reached the end date \
`CANCELLED`: Standing order has been cancelled by the sender.
